newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won falls to 887.60, lowest since 1990.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won falls to 887.60, lowest since 1990.

text.p: The South Korean won fell to 887.60 to the dollar in Monday mid-morning trade, the lowest since the country introduced a market average system in March 1990, dealers said.
The won opened at 886.90 versus the dollar on Monday after closing at 884.90 on Friday.
Dealers said the won's weakness stemmed from the nation's widening trade deficit and the reopening of a prosecution probe into a loan scandal involving Hanbo Steel Co.
"The probe adds to the country's economic woes," a foreign bank dealer said. "With the prospects of a weakening economy, demand for the dollar contined to strengten."
The central bank intervened in early morning trade, offering to sell dollars at 899.00 won in the three-month forward trading and at 913.00 in the six-month forward trading.
